intro: Schefflera hexaphylla, commonly known as the African shield fern, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to eastern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, compound leaves that form a compact, bushy shape. The plant features multiple leaflets arranged in a whorled pattern around the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-drained soil. Schefflera hexaphylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to indoor conditions.
